pr_title: Updates to Brave 5.11.2 and backfills tests

timeline.bodyText: I tried status exception with cause, but that eats the causes message in favor of the generic message from the status code.
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt

timeline.bodyText: chatted about this with @anuraaga.. maybe we can share the clock used for the log timestamps in armeria with brave perhaps..
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt
trustin

replies.bodyText: this doesn't set the exception message, only the http body (and that isn't used as the message..)
replies.author: codefromthecrypt

replies.bodyText: usually there's a way to set status independent of the throwable, but this can work if we can control the message of the HttpResponseException (ex by adding a parameter) currently it has null message.
replies.author: codefromthecrypt

replies.bodyText: Actually, just throwing an exception was the right way to do in this case. Sorry about the noise.
replies.author: trustin

replies.bodyText: but I do want to control the status code on error.. this helps show if a default of 500 isn't accidentally assumed.
replies.author: codefromthecrypt

timeline.author: ikhoon

timeline.bodyText: can we get a constructor like this please? it will help with testing to know difference between throwable message and http body.
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt

timeline.bodyText: anything obvious here? the body is not in the server context.
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt

replies.bodyText: I mean this lambda cannot see the trace context... neither does the one for baggage
replies.author: codefromthecrypt

replies.bodyText:
Actually I'm surprised this doesn't fail, I thought we have some validation for duplicate paths /cc @minwoox @ikhoon
While I'm not sure, I suspect the issue is having two services mounted at the same path /child, which I think is messing with the decoration logic.
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText:
I thought we have some validation for duplicate paths

The default is just warning. https://github.com/line/armeria/blob/master/core/src/main/java/com/linecorp/armeria/server/ServerBuilder.java#L199
We should set another handler for different behavior.
replies.author: minwoox

replies.bodyText: Ah thanks now I remember, probably was a warning here then :)
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: this test is a single child household. the other will be sold off for medical experiments
replies.author: codefromthecrypt

replies.bodyText: this duplicate made the other things fail!
replies.author: codefromthecrypt

timeline.bodyText: any hint on how to forward "/items/:itemId" under /nested?
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt

replies.bodyText: there's no subrouting feature so I'll leave this one out.
replies.author: codefromthecrypt

timeline.bodyText: this doesn't end up as ServiceRequestContext.responseCause()
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt

timeline.bodyText: there's a code change needed to HttpServerHandler to set the HttpResponseException's cause to the context responseCause. Any hints or help appreciated! cc @trustin
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt

timeline.message: Updates to Brave 5.10.2 and backfills tests
decouples merging this from the http response cause topic
Fix a few TODOs in `BraveServiceIntegrationTest` / Indentation

timeline.bodyText: I don't see how we are setting the status code 503, though.. we should put a TODO until we do?
timeline.author: codefromthecrypt

timeline.message: let the fuzz be with you
